ygData.subject: Re: On alliance again
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes, two important differences here: against Agressive beasties, only use mez, because mem blur is useless, since you will most likely just be targeted again.
ygData.messageBody:
Yes, two important differences here:
against Agressive beasties, only use mez, because mem blur is useless,
since you will most likely just be targeted again. against very very
high level thigns, such as a loose giant, Mez is useless, which is where
Memory Blur is a svaing grace, or was. I read in a psot today that
someone was still able at lvl 16 to mem blur a loose Sand Giant.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Farr, Robert [SMTP:robert.farr@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, May 19, 1999 2:47 PM
> To: 'eqenchanters@onelist.com'
> Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] On alliance again
>
> From: "Farr, Robert" <robert.farr@...>
>
> Mesmerize does the same for me. I use it all the time on wisps in
> Erud's
> Crossing if I get doubleteamed. I mes one and kill the other. I have
> never
> had the one that I mesmerized attack me again.
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Hapke, Matthew [SMTP:mahapke@...]
> > Sent: Wednesday, May 19, 1999 2:53 PM
> > To: 'eqenchanters@onelist.com'
> > Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] On alliance again
> >
> > From: "Hapke, Matthew" <mahapke@...>
> >
> > I have had whirl, just this morning, last for less then 2 seconds, 7
> > times in a row. It never lasts full duration at all, and I am
> fighting
> > blues, totally. Risky or dangerous, doesn't seem to matter.
> >
> > Memory Blur is what I would deem a get out of Jail free card. It is
> a
> > second chance basically. Against Non Agressive beasts, it is a
> do-over.
> > It stops them in their tracks, and makes em forget. It doesn't
> freeze
> > them like mez does. But, my big use for it was saving a beach full
> of
> > Croc surfers from the wet sandal fate. Up comes the big hill giant,
> out
> > goes the Memory Blur, bingo! Instantly make 20 new friends =) I
> don't
> > think I will try this much now, considering the giant will resist
> me.
> > That was the only situation I found it useful for.
> >
> >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: Farr, Robert [SMTP:robert.farr@...]
> > > Sent: Wednesday, May 19, 1999 2:37 PM
> > > To: 'eqenchanters@onelist.com'
> > > Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] On alliance again
> > >
> > > From: "Farr, Robert" <robert.farr@...>
> > >
> > > I haven't had any problems with whirl. In what way is it supposed
> to
> > > be
> > > broken?
> > >
> > > I haven't had any problem with memory blur because I am still
> using
> > > mesmerize. I didn't notice that memory blur offered anything else
> > > besides an
> > > increased mana use...
> > >
> > > > -----Original Message-----
> > > > From: Hapke, Matthew [SMTP:mahapke@...]
> > > > Sent: Wednesday, May 19, 1999 2:36 PM
> > > > To: 'eqenchanters@onelist.com'
> > > > Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] On alliance again
> > > >
> > > > From: "Hapke, Matthew" <mahapke@...>
> > > >
> > > > IMproved the effectiveness of what spells?!?
> > > > I have seen these improvements for us lately:
> > > >
> > > > 1. Memory Blur can now be resisted.
> > > > 2. Whirl Can now be broken
> > > > 3. Whirl now has a horridly random amount of time.
> > > >
> > > > So, what exactly is better here?
> > > >
> > > > > -----Original Message-----
> > > > > From: Shawn Alley [SMTP:ShawnA@...]
> > > > > Sent: Wednesday, May 19, 1999 2:23 PM
> > > > > To: 'eqenchanters@onelist.com'
> > > > > Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] On alliance again
> > > > >
> > > > > From: Shawn Alley <ShawnA@...>
> > > > >
> > > > > Variant just improved the effectiveness of some spells. They
> may
> > > work
> > > > > on this spell (and others) if we continue to let them know the
> > > spell
> > > > > isn't doing what we expected. So keep your hopes up, this
> line of
> > > > > spells may be more powerful at some point!
> > > > >
> > > > > -----Original Message-----
> > > > > From: HiFi Review [mailto:hifireview@...]
> > > > > Sent: Wednesday, May 19, 1999 12:18 PM
> > > > > To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
> > > > > Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] On alliance again
> > > > >
> > > > >
> > > > > From: HiFi Review <hifireview@...>
> > > > >
> > > > > Then we can save a few coppers on our 100PP + platinum bars.
> :)
> > > > >
> > > > > --- Rob Berryhill <racefan@...> wrote:
> > > > > > From: "Rob Berryhill" <racefan@...>
> > > > > >
> > > > > > It's pretty much worthless. If you use it for an
> > > > > > item that costs 100+pp you
> > > > > > *might* save a copper or two.
> > > > > >
